column4: Q: I'm trying to copy everything from my system drive to a blank drive, and when I use cp -rv * /media/other, it gets stuck at copying 'proc/kmsg'... just pauses for a really long time. Is there a reason for that, or a better way to duplicate the entire system?
disk dump -- makes an exact image of your disk.
august issue of linux user magazine has a great article on this.
i followed the grub HOWTO, first of all i just got the word GRUB on the screen, wouldnt boot.Copying grub from the old to new drive wont work?
no, you just need to set it up, grub-install /dev/whateveristhebootdrive
wassat? I dont think i am ...
okay then, ignore what I said :)
i did a sudo grub-install /dev/hdd1 but all i get is GRUB on the screen when i restart... ?
you need to install it on /dev/hdd (if that really is your drive, more than likely, its /dev/hda)
am i going to run into problems when i reorganise the drives ie. the old master gets removed and the new one gets plugged in as Primary Master?
to be honest, you should not -- beyond the fact that if you were auto-mounting your old master, then it would not mount properly, but that is a minor thing.
is there a config file, like menu.lst, that i can check to see if its going to start up when i switch the drives over?
